characters: INSIDE THE LEAD HIGHWAY PATROL CAR
THE OTHER SIDE OF THE FENCE
BANDIT I AND THE PICKUP TRUCK
KYLE BRAND AND HIS SON DICKEY
THE BACK DOORS OF THE TRUCK
AN ABANDONED FRUIT AND VEGETABLE STAND
ANOTHER SECTION OF THE MISSISSIPPI HIGHWAY

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Georgia. Two-lane blacktop, stretching from here to heave Empty. Silent. Then, suddenly in the far distance, severa dark specks rise over a hill and head straight toward cam Camera holds and the specks begin to take form. Vehicles. Trucks. Six monstrous eighteen-wheel diesels, coming at u their smokestacks blasting. Sound grows louder, as we beg to hear snatches of Citizens Band Radio talk over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Breaker, this is Banana Peel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yeah, Breaker go head on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Thanks much. I'd like to get me a  Smokey report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Road looks clean as a hound's  tooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Okey, doke. Last one to the Roadeo  is a homo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voices fade and titles and credits begin. "Black Smoke Bl Over Eighteen Wheels" by Red Simpson comes up in the b.g. the six trucks blast right over camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the trucks driving through an entrance gate to a huge  parking lot. Over the gate is a sign reading: "GEORGIA TR ROADEO STATE FINALS." Music and credits continue.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK ROADEO
dialogues.text: Macks, Kenworths, Whites and Jimmys, all polished to a  mirrored finish. Truck drivers decked out in their flashi western outfits. The stands filled with spectators on the edge of their seats, watching the gearjammers put their r through tests of skill and reflexes -- parallel parking,  driving around eggs, through complicated barricades, etc.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA PICKS UP
dialogues.text: a customized white Cadillac convertible pulling into the  Roadeo grounds. The Caddy has mounted chrome quarter hors on each front fender, bull horns on the front bumper, sta rifles displayed in the rear. Garish. The car's Texas lic plate reads "Mr. Big."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac stops. Two men climb out and wend their way  through the trucks and spectators. Camera tracks behind t Although we can't see their faces, we see that one man is pudgy and decked out in a fancy white western suit and ha The other is younger, tall, skinny and wearing a grey wes suit and hat. Kyle Brand and his son Dickey.

dialogues.speaker: ROADEO INFIELD
dialogues.text: The crowd roars, as the trucks race through an obstacle  course.

dialogues.speaker: THE MEN
dialogues.text: Camera still on their backs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to race) Is that Bandit in the lead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that sumbitch was in the race,  he'd be in the winner's circle by  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still think this whole idea is  dumb, pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it must be a helluva idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle laughs. His laugh then turns into a hacking cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just rent a Lear jet  and haul it back ourselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I wanna see this hot shot  Bandit do something that can't be  done. Besides, there's nothing I  like better than breaking legends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, coughs again, continues walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not getting it) But if it can't be done, how's he  gonna do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the point, Dickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you just find him, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dickey crosses to a trucker couple, polishing up their ch rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, hoss. Where might I locate the  Bandit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (immediately) Over there behind his rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Husband shoots his old lady a jealous look. Dickey re Kyle and they head toward Bandit LaRue's truck.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING
dialogues.text: as they come to the only battered, beaten-up eighteen-whe at the entire Truck Roadeo. It looks like it hasn't been  washed since it left the showroom. On one side of the truck is a faded and peeling mural of stagecoach being held up. A teamster and a shotgun guard  have their hands high in the air and a Bandit on horsebac has a six-gun pointed at them. An elaborate CB radio antenna grows out of the cab beside the driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE AND DICKEY
dialogues.text: as they round the truck and stop in their tracks.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: A hammock is stretched from the cab of the truck to an oa tree. A man wearing a faded denim western shirt, open wit the sleeves rolled up, levis and silver-toed cowboy boots lying in the hammock. A cowboy hat covers his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as shadows fall across the figure. The man slowly tips ba his hat and we see he's in his thirties, boyishly handsom with a cocky smile. Bandit LaRue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for the first time we get a look at Kyle and Dickey.  Kyle is wearing sunglasses and diamond rings on every fin His smile is as tasteless as the suit he wears. Dickey is in his early twenties. Blonde, blue-eyed and sc to death of his old man. Bandit looks at them for a moment, then casually pulls th hat back over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, ain't you glad to see me, Bandit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hat over his face) Yeah, it's the highlight of my day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a long pause interrupted by Kyle's hacking cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dickey) What's he get if he wins here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hat over his face) If...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chickenshit money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle coughs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hat over his face) Could you turn your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit gets up and begins untying the hammock from the tr Kyle crosses to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Kyle; I ain't in this Truck  Roadeo for the money. It's the  challenge. You know, the ecstasy of  victory, the agony of defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle looks out at the cheering crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe there's two thousand  people here to watch a bunch of guys  back up their trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America's bored. (then) Now, what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You to forget this dumbass Roadeo  and take on a real challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bandit turns to him, we:

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT'S TRUCK
dialogues.text: Bandit, wearing aviator shades and his cowboy hat, is bac the truck up and shouting down to Kyle and Dickey on the  ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy, man. Smart dresser,  but crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Legend has it  Bandit LaRue's king of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can make it to Texarkana and back  in twenty-eight hours... that's no  sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't ever been done before, hot  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles at Dickey,  then) See, running Coors Beer east of Texas  is what bothers me. It makes me a  bootlegger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear a few weeks ago you smuggled  sixteen Beaners up to West Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how rumors start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're just yellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful psychology. Why don't you  say something about my mom? (then) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit drives toward the starting line for another event. Kyle and Dickey run alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coughs, then) Look, you make this little run for  me, I'll buy you a new rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating truck) Last year, this was a new rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it wasn't a Kenworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dickey turns to his father, stunned, as Bandit stops the  truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Pop, a K-Whopper's worth seventy  thou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting) Seventy-two five. (then) Why do you want this barley pop so  bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit smiles at Dickey again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a boy running in the Peach  Tree Classic tomorrow and when he  wins, I wanna celebrate in style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much style?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred cases worth. (a long pause) Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) You paying for the gas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle smiles that unwinning smile and takes out a huge wad bills, as we:

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: Picturesque. Bandit's eighteen-wheeler rolling down the  Georgia highway, past lush green meadows and endless acre of pines. Over this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya mean, we're not going to the  show tonight?

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TRUCK, (DIALOGUE OVERLAPS)
dialogues.text: And for the first time, we get a real look inside the rig It's quite a set-up. The opposite of the outside. Home on the road. Sheepskin over the two front seats, a poster of Raquel We in a bikini tacked above the windshield, under which is a bumper sticker reading: "Do It For Truckers." On the dash board, a St. Christopher medal and a chattering skull. Al a stereo tape deck and the best Citizens Band Radio outfi money can buy. Bandit is on the C.B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Hot Pants, I got no choice. I gotta  make a run to Texarkana. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) But you been promising to take me  for three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Baby, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Break. Break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Yeah, breaker; come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Hot Pants, this here is Sugar Man.  I'll take you to the show tonight.  Pick you up at seven. How am I hitting  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Bull's-eye, Sugar Man. Bandit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Go sit on a cold carrot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit looks at the mike and we:

dialogues.speaker: RESIDENTIAL STREET
dialogues.text: Bandit's truck pulls to a stop in front of a small white  clapboard house.

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Most of the furniture is old and what isn't, is covered w plastic. No fancy carpets or objects d'art. On the coffee table is an open, colorfully illustrated Bible. A blonde  wood television set sits in a corner of the room. There a a lot of toy trucks lying around and over the mantel is a oil painting of a fancy eighteen-wheeler with an epitaph  under it reading: "I'd rather be a truck driver, than be millionaire..." Bandit is trying to get into the bedroom, but his path is being blocked by a faded Georgia beauty lost somewhere in her thirties. Waynette Snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to get past  her) Goddamn, Waynette; you sure do look  foxy today. If you weren't already  married, I'd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me that horseshit, Bandit.  You ain't seeing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (determined) Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (equally determined) No, you ain't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scrawny little Kid runs through the room, followed by a even scrawnier mutt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Uncle Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Kid) He ain't your damn uncle and get  that mutt outta here. He just peed  all over my hot curlers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit takes the moment to slide past Waynette and duck i the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: is dark. The venetian blinds are drawn. Bandit hurries in the room with Waynette still hollering in the b.g. He passes a French Provincial dresser with a small fleet model trucks on top and crosses to a Lump sleeping face d on a double bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking the Lump) Cledus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not moving) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking him again) Wake up, man; I just got us a hot  run for big bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit goes to the closet and begins tossing clothes onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly rolling over) Whadda we have to do -- kidnap the  Pope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from closet) How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes out of the closet with the rest of the clothes a tosses them on the bed, then crosses to the dresser drawe and throws a pair of socks and underwear at Cledus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, all we gotta do is make a run  to Texarkana... (under his breath) ...in twenty-eight hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus Snow slowly comes up from under the covers and we our first glimpse of him. He's thirty-three, but you'd ne take him for a day under forty. Trucker all the way. He's wearing boxer shorts and an undershirt. As he reaches acr to the nightstand and puts on a pair of glasses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-eight hours! You're outta  your gord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that any way to talk to your ole  partner? (pulling back blanket) Look, it's only nine hundred miles  each way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (figuring quick) That means we gotta average ninety- four miles per. (lying back down) Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's ever done it before. This'll  put us on the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or in the slammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I tell you they're gonna give us  a brand new Kenworth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up) Waynette!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE CLEDUS' HOUSE
dialogues.text: Bandit sits inside the cab of the truck, nervously tappin his foot and watching Cledus' kids play football on the f lawn. The mutt keeps getting in their way. Bandit hits the horn and an instant later, Cledus steps o the front porch, followed by Waynette. He's wearing a pla shirt, levis, a large engraved cowboy belt and a thermal  vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him a thermos) This ain't fair. You're letting him  talk you into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (buttoning shirt) I swear to God, pumpkin; I'll be  back before you know it. (sly smile) And then I'll make you glad you was  born a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just might not be waiting  this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit toots again. Waynette gives him "the finger."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, please... Don't be this way.  You know I'd do anything for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take Fred.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The eighteen-wheeler heading west, stacks open. Over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, man; Fred'll be no  problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can tell he's gonna be a  major asset.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAB, (DIALOGUE OVERLAPS)
dialogues.text: Fred, the mutt, lays with his head slumped over Bandit's  leg. Cledus is at the wheel, wearing clip-on sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Fred; enough fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit picks Fred up and dumps him onto the sleeper  compartment behind the seats. Then, starts going over a r map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know of course, we ain't ever  gonna make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) Quit being so negative, guy; 'course  we're gonna make it. We ain't never  not made it, have we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our asses gonna be in a sling if we  get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up, straight  to him) And if we don't, they're gonna be  riding high in a brand new Kenworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As "Truck Driving Man" by Red Steagall starts over, Cledu looks at Bandit, sighs -- then punches it.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF LAP DISSOLVES
dialogues.text: roaring down the highway. Music continues, as slowly day  becomes night and the truck whizzes across the Alabama an Mississippi State Lines.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The rig is parked on the shoulder under a highway light.  Bandit and Cledus stand by the side of the truck, as Fred wanders aimlessly around the grassy knoll off the shoulde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping his fingers  impatiently) How long's this gonna take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, man. Ask him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) We gotta let the slack out, Cledus;  this is costing us time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ask me, I think we should  make that run to Choo Choo Town and  pick up that load of lumber. Nice.  Easy. And within the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I still don't think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit walks away from Cledus in mid-sentence, heading fo the rear of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin' now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to open  rear doors) Running blocker.

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK DOORS OF THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: As Bandit swings them open, Cledus adjusts one of two ram that have now been mounted on the rear of the truck's flo As Cledus kicks the ramp into place, Bandit climbs into t back of the trailer and disappears. After a moment, there is a deafening roar and suddenly, t headlights are GLARING straight at camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat and slowly, a full-blown SHELBY COBRA II appears f inside the truck. As it moves slowly down the ramp, we se it has twelve coats of black lacquer, red pinstriping,  aluminum mags, twelve-inch Firestones, the works. A mean  machine. On the rear bumper is a CB antenna matching the one on th truck.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA FOLLOWS
dialogues.text: as Bandit guides the Cobra down the ramp. Cledus quickly  folds up the ramp and dumps it back into the truck. He sl the metal doors closed and crosses to the Cobra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, here's our plan of  communication, so as to avoid Smokey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if I say go to channel three,  it really means go to six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Six. Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I say go to twenty-one, go to  nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to remember) Twenty-one is nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I say go to two, it's really one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now totally confused) Two is one. (then) Listen, let's just stay on the odd  channels and switch everytime. Start  in the basement. Now, let's haul  ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus grabs Fred, who's still peeing and bounds up the m steps of the cab. As Bandit lays twenty feet of rubber, w

dialogues.speaker: MISSISSIPPI HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Cobra followed by the Eighteen-wheeler whip past came (NOTE: From this point on, the Cobra will be referred to Bandit I. The Eighteen-wheeler as Bandit II.)

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I, (THE COBRA)
dialogues.text: The car is cherry. Wooden steering wheel, all leather  upholstery stereo tape deck, harness-style seat belts and CB radio identical to the one in Bandit II. Bandit is talking to Cledus on the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Bandit One, am I hitting you?

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT II, (THE EIGHTEEN-WHEELER)
dialogues.text: Cledus picks up his mike. Fred is now riding shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) You're wall to wall and tree top  tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I'm gonna run a couple miles ahead  of you. Keep both feet on the floor.  We'll be moving ninety and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike; after a  beat) Bandit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Why are we doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then into  mike) Because they said it couldn't be  done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And:

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I and II screaming through the Mississippi night.  Over this a driving Doug Kershaw fiddle.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit driving, sipping coffee from a thermos. Sees somet

dialogues.speaker: HIS VIEW
dialogues.text: A Mississippi Highway Patrol Car is approaching from the  opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BANDIT
dialogues.text: as he eases up on the pedal and fires up his CB mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Bandit Two, do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit glances up in his rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH REAR VIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: The Mississippi HPC, zips past Bandit and moves on down t highway.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I AND II, (DIALOGUE OVERLAPS)
dialogues.text: Cledus picks up his mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Loud and clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Pull your hammer back, Smokey's coming  at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus immediately backs off the accelerator and slows do an instant before the Mississippi HPC passes by. Everythi is cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) He's history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Okay, we got a straight shot to T  Town, so let her roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we:

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: As night slowly begins fading back into day, Bandit I and Bandit II blast across the Arkansas State Line.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN RISING
dialogues.text: behind a sign that reads: Welcome to Texarkana, Texas. A  beat and two blurs whip past camera. Bandit I and II.

dialogues.speaker: THE WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: Bandit I followed by Bandit II pull into the loading area a large warehouse. The place is locked up and the loading dock is empty. Ban and Cledus park their vehicles and climb out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! No one's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking watch) That's 'cause we're damn near an  hour ahead of schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's keep it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit grabs a crowbar from Bandit I and we:

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: Pitch black. A beat, then a loud smash o.s. and the door  slides open, sending a stream of light across the warehou floor. Bandit and Cledus step inside. Bandit crosses to the ligh switch and hits it. Suddenly the entire room is bathed in flourescent. We see the warehouse is filled with cases up cases of Coors Beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whistles low) Liquid gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Redneck heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cross back to the large sliding door and as Bandit p it open, Cledus jumps into the truck's cab and begins bac the big rig up to the loading dock.

dialogues.speaker: THE WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: The rig's doors are open and ready for loading. Cledus an Bandit cross to a brand new fork-lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to drive one of these  things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can a pig whistle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit climbs into the seat of the fork-lift and turns th key. The engine roars to life. He grins and confidently t it into gear. The fork-lift leaps backward and begins spe wildly around the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Hit the brakes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're jammed!

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING THE FORK-LIFT
dialogues.text: as it smashes into stacks of Coors cases, sending them fl in every direction and tossing Bandit out of the seat -- into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit crashes to the ground, surrounded by cases of b He looks up to Cledus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for whistling pigs.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: Bandit II is now almost filled with cases of Coors, as Cl guides the fork-lift's final load onto the loading dock. and Bandit unload the final cases and Cledus parks the fo lift. They look around. The place is a wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get the hell outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we pay 'em for the damages?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps his fingers) Right. Give me your pen. We'll tell  'em to bill Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bandit pulls out a piece of paper and Cledus hands him pen, we:

dialogues.speaker: THE TEXARKANA CITY LIMITS SIGN
dialogues.text: as again, two blurs flash past camera, moving south. Band I and Bandit II -- heading home.

dialogues.speaker: ARKANSAS HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: It's now mid-morning, as Camera follows Bandit I and II  rolling through hog country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) We still on schedule?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Forty-two minutes ahead.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit holding the CB mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I hate to say I told you so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Save it. We got a long haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Clear and rolling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the mike, then sees something ahead of him he can't believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the middle of the highway is a GIRL in a wedd gown. Off to the side, on the shoulder, is a customized C with a "Just Married" sign on the back and strings of tin cans, shoes and streamers. The hood of the Camaro is up.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: as Bandit eases off the accelerator and starts to move ar the Girl. But the Girl moves with him, waving and blocking his path Bandit's forced to pull off the road and stop. The Girl r up to the Cobra and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (climbing in) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it was nothing) Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girl slams the door and turns to Bandit. She's tall a sophisticated. A hyper New Yorker in her late twenties. K McCONNELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit I pulls away in a cloud of dust and squealing t a beat-up VAN passes, going the other way. THREE SHITKICKER KIDS are riding in the Van. They watch B leaving the abandoned "Just Married" car and brake to tur around. Bandit and Kate don't notice.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: picking up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Who's the unlucky guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate takes off her veil and shakes down her hair. She's a beauty. Bandit immediately notices, but keeps driving. Sh starts talking a mile-a-minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I was in Texas dancing in an  industrial show for Sunkist Oranges.  They say I'm the new Anita Bryant.  But I'm really a dancer from New  York. A lot of credits. Moderate  talent. (rolling on) Anyway, after opening night, I was  walking back to the motor lodge and  suddenly there he was. A tall Texan  with a twenty-nine inch waist. Pure  dynamite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All sound reasons for matrimony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm a twenty-eight year old  hoofer who spends most of her time  with fags. Besides, I'm impulsive.  It runs in the family. We're all  crazy. Mind if I smoke? (lights a cigarette) Anyway, today was the 'bid day.' But  as I was walking down the aisle, I  realized this is total insanity.  What am I going to do in Texas the  rest of my life? I can't marry Jerry  Jeff. I mean, we're eventually gonna  have to talk. So, halfway down the  aisle, I turned and split. You think  I'm nuts, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. In fact, I picked up  a bride yesterday; except she was a  singer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Cledus interrupts over the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit I, do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up mike) This is Bandit I, come back.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I AND II
dialogues.text: Cledus on the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Who's the broad? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit turns to the Girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate McConnell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Kate McConnell. Sweet, shy... well- dressed. I'm giving her a lift to  the next waterhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Listen, pardner; this ain't no time  to be getting laid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Believe me, that won't be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT II
dialogues.text: Cledus replaces the CB mike and slips Red Simpson's  "Motivatin' Man" into the tape deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never fails. Bandit gets a chick. I  get...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over at Fred, who's now passed out in the passen seat.

dialogues.speaker: SHINY STRIP OF CHROME
dialogues.text: as a pair of plyers rip it off the side of a car and we E BACK to see:

dialogues.speaker: KATE'S ABANDONED CAMARO
dialogues.text: still parked along the Arkansas Highway -- now almost  completely stripped by the THREE KIDS in the Van. The car up on jacks, as one of the Kids, rolls the last of the fo tires to the rear of the Van. Another kid dumps the chrom stripping into the cab, while the third, unscrews the rad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a TEXAS SHERIFF'S CAR skids to a stop behind them. SHE BUELL CLAYTON climbs out. Fifty. Ruggedly handsome. An  imposing figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids freeze, as the Sheriff strides up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading) I swear to God, officer; the car  was. already like this, we were just  trying to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sheriff Clayton doesn't even notice they've stripped  down the entire car. He's got other problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the gal who was driving?  She was wearing a wedding dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all nod, still shaking in their jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly) Yes, sir. She got into a cherry- looking Cobra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get a look at the driver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but he had Georgia plates. BAN- ONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton turns on his heels and leaps back into the Sherif car, muttering to himself. He jams it into gear and peels out in a cloud of dust. The kids exchange bewildered looks, then immediately go b to stripping the Camaro.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit watching the road. Kate watching Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why're you driving so fast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get back to Atlanta in  thirteen hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You have a bowling date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute. No, 'cause no one's ever made  it from Atlanta to Texarkana and  back in twenty-eight hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd want to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never looked at it that way. (then) You ask a lot of questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this obviously  macho feat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a new Kenworth. That's a truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) A truck? You're doing this for a  truck? That's insanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a truck. It's the Rolls  Royce of eighteen-wheelers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you could get killed, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you could get killed crossing  the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An existentialist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to her) A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lights up another cigarette, as we:

dialogues.speaker: A BIRD'S EYE VIEW
dialogues.text: of an endless stretch of Arkansas Highway. Camera follows two vehicles -- hauling ass. Bandit I, followed a couple miles back by Bandit II.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit and Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning back in her  seat) So tell me about yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya want to know? My sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want to know what you think  about besides ditching Smokey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving, talking to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both a challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a great profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do. Especially from that  angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mattoon, Illinois. But I moved down  south to work in the Civil Rights  movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (obviously lying) Would I lie to you?

dialogues.speaker: AN ARKANSAS HIGHWAY PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: parked off to the side of the highway behind an abandoned and boarded up diner. The Patrol Car is empty and from a  little transistor radio hanging on the rear view mirror,  Merle Haggard sings, "I Take A Lot Of Pride In What I Am. Camera moves off the Patrol Car and finds it's Driver, an Arkansas Highway Patrolman with crew cut, taking a leak. Suddenly, Bandit I whips past doing at least a hundred an almost blowing the OFFICER over. He quickly zips up and r to his car.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Kate has seen the Cop. Bandit hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just passed your nemesis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smokey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit glances up in his rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH REAR VIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: the Arkansas Highway Patrol car coming after him, it's  advertising twirling and siren wailing.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bandit turns to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better fasten your seat belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit slams on his brakes, locking all four tires and se the Cobra into a four wheel drift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they're sliding) Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She buckles up, as Bandit grabs for the CB mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Bandit Two. I'm gonna leave you for  a minute. Back in a flash.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT II
dialogues.text: Cledus on the CB mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Keep 'er between the ditches.

dialogues.speaker: ARKANSAS HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I slides broadside down the highway and exits down dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: DIRT ROAD
dialogues.text: Bandit I roars down the road, leaving clouds of dust in i wake.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Arkansas Highway Patrol car does a 180 in the middle the highway and takes the dirt road turnoff.

dialogues.speaker: DIRT ROAD
dialogues.text: Bandit I blasts up the dirt road, leaving trails of billo dust behind him. The Arkansas Highway Patrol Car in hot  pursuit. Over this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forget to tell you. I'm running  blocker for four hundred cases of  illegal brew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thought I had problems.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HIGHWAY PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: The windshield of the car is covered with dust. The Offic tries to squint through it, but the dust keeps building u Finally, he turns on his windshield wipers, making the du twice as thick. And now he can't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit looks over his shoulder. Nothing but a solid wall dust. He whips the Cobra around a hairpin turn and floors it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Highway Patrol Car misses the turn and goes off the r Out of control, the car smashes through a clapboard fence and sails into:

dialogues.speaker: A SWAMP
dialogues.text: It lands with a gigantic splash and water fills the FRAME

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: roaring down the dirt road. Kate is turned around in her  seat, looking through the rear window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back around) We're cool. The dumb schmuck took  the wrong turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both breathe a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to be when you grow  up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he can answer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) Bandit I. Bandit I. Do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bandit reaches for the mike to answer Cledus, he glanc up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRACTOR has moved from behind a tree and is crossing th road directly in front of Bandit I. Bandit tosses the CB mike to Kate with one hand and swerv the wheel to the right with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Say this is Bandit I. Then, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bandit blasts around the Tractor and down the road, Ka talks into the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) This is Bandit I. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Where the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Smokey was on our tail. We had to  take a detour to ditch the motherfu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) You can't swear on these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) What's going on, Bandit? Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Tell him we'll be back on the highway  in a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kate starts talking, Fred spots some cows grazing and  starts barking like crazy. Cledus can't hear a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the dog) Shut up, Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bandit) Who's Fred?

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CLAYTON'S CAR
dialogues.text: Sheriff Clayton's been listening to this whole exchange o his CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit II. We'll be back on the  highway in a second. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep my eyeballs peeled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thin smile) So will I, hoss. So will I.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Kate replaces the CB mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to CB) These things are fabulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're not a bad driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're not a bad passenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They glance at each other for a moment, then both look aw Back at each other. Then away again. And we:

dialogues.speaker: ARKANSAS HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The eighteen-wheel Bandit II, rolling.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER SECTION OF THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Sheriff Clayton barrelling down the blacktop.

dialogues.speaker: AN EMBANKMENT
dialogues.text: as Bandit I screeches up over the embankment -- putting h back on the highway. He floors it and they're off.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit flicks his CB selector to the next odd channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Bandit II, do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I AND II
dialogues.text: Cledus picks up the mike. Fred is now snoring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) This is Bandit II. Now, where the  hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) On two lane blacktop. Mile marker  six-one. How we doin' on time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks watch, then  into mike) Thirty-eight minutes ahead of  schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) What's your twenty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm 'bout four miles ahead of you,  turkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Not for long, you ain't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bandit's about to hang up the mike, a NEW VOICE comes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) Breaker. Breaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Go breaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) Bandit, I just thought I'd lay a  Smokey report on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Go head on, breaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) I would say your future's looking  dim, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike, nervous) What's your twenty and what's your  handle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) My handle's Smokey Bear and I got  you by the tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIREN BLASTS behind them, whipping Bandit and Kate arou

dialogues.speaker: THEIR VIEW
dialogues.text: Sheriff Clayton is right on their ass -- no more than thr feet away -- his siren wailing and his advertising flashi

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bandit slams down the CB mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) That's a Texas cop. What the hell's  he doing in Arkansas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy) I don't know. Maybe Jerry Jeff sent  the heat after us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) A Texas Bear in Arkansas. (then) Something's up and at this point in  my life, I don't want to know what  it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trounces on it and the Shelby Cobra II springs to life laying twenty feet of third gear rubber. Suddenly, the Te Sheriff's car looks like it's standing on jacks.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE SHERIFF'S CAR
dialogues.text: as Sheriff Clayton floorboards it and takes off after Ban I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I'm gonna get that bastard. No one  makes Buell Clayton look like a fool.  Let's get going.

dialogues.speaker: ARKANSAS HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: as Bandit I races past camera. A beat and here comes the  Texas Sheriff. Hard and fast.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit is all concentration. Both hands on the wheel. Pre 120 MPH. Kate fumbles for her cigarettes, but they all go flying out of the pack. One lands on her lap. She lights

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT'S VIEW
dialogues.text: up ahead, the big rear end of Bandit II.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bandit fires up his CB and flips to the next odd channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I'm whipping around you, Bandit II.  Smokey on the rubber.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT II
dialogues.text: Cledus looks up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: HIS VIEW
dialogues.text: Traffic. Coming head on.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO CLEDUS
dialogues.text: keying the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) You're gonna have to create your own  lane, buddy. You got oncoming.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit turns to Kate. She shrugs and closes her eyes. He  floors it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a mile-a-minute) You know, my mother was a dancer,  too. Her big shot was the touring  company of 'Brigadoon.' She's been  married three times. To a redneck, a  poet and her tennis instructor. (not missing a beat) See, I motor-mouth when I get nervous.  I was nervous when I first got into  the car. Now I'm scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, there's nothing to be  afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Bandit flies off the highway, onto the shoulde Kate closes her eyes even tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit pulls alongside the big eighteen-wheeler, hangi onto the shoulder for his life.

dialogues.speaker: HIS VIEW
dialogues.text: up ahead -- a dirt road crossing. He'll never make it pas the huge eighteen-wheeler in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit I hits the dirt road crossing, flies into the a comes down, smashes into a highway sign and sends it  splintering twenty feet into the air. Before he can whip wheel around, Bandit is staring at an endless row of rura mailboxes. Kate turns her head, as Bandit I mows down the mailboxes. Whap! Whap! Whap! Whap! Whap! Bandit drops the Cobra into first, zooms past Bandit II a sails back onto the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate slowly opens her eyes. She's alive.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CLAYTON'S CAR
dialogues.text: trapped behind the huge eighteen-wheeler. Clayton pulls o in an attempt to squeeze between Bandit II and the oncomi traffic. Brakes squeal, as SEVEN CARS are forced to hit the side  shoulder. Just as Clayton moves halfway past the eighteen wheeler, Cledus puts on the press -- edging Sheriff Clayt over. Clayton's rear fender catches on the rig and rips off wit terrifying SCREECH. As his fender bounces down the highwa Clayton pulls in front of Bandit II a split-second before oncoming BUS almost creams him.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT II
dialogues.text: Cledus sees the passing car is Texas heat and immediately flips over to the next odd channel and keys up his CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Bandit I, do I have copy?

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I AND II
dialogues.text: Bandit's pushing the red line on his speedometer and gest for Kate to pick up the CB mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Yeah, Bandit II, Que pasa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) That's a Texas bubble gum machine on  your back porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has no idea what he  just said) What's he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit grabs the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (driving and talking) Uh, Cledus; I noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to hang it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) What's a Texas Smokey doing in  Arkansas, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling into mike) If I knew, Cledus; I'd be on College  Bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit slams down the mike and the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: and the chase is on. High speed. Way over a hundred. Two  blurs through the Arkansas countryside.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CLAYTON'S CAR
dialogues.text: Sheriff Clayton is on his police radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) This is Sheriff Clayton. In pursuit  of a black Shelby Cobra, Georgia  license Boy-Adam-Nora. Ocean-Nora- Eddie. Request assistance.

dialogues.speaker: TWO ARKANSAS SHERIFF'S CARS
dialogues.text: blasting off down the highway in response. Lights twirlin Sirens wailing.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE LEAD CAR
dialogues.text: SHERIFF WILLY BRANFORD is riding shotgun. He's fat and  arrogant. He chews bubble gum as he talks on the radio mi A DEPUTY is driving. He's twenty-five, wears long sidebur and mirrored sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) This is Sheriff Branford of Crossett  County. We're already on this joker's  case. (he pops a bubble) I got two units intercepting him at  Hamburg crossing. You say you was a  Sheriff?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFFS CLAYTON AND BRANFORD
dialogues.text: Clayton has trouble steering and talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) That's a big ten-four. Sheriff Buell  Clayton. Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned, into mike) Texas? What the hell you doing in my  goddam county?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that instant, Clayton hits a rut in the road and drops his mike. He bends to pick it up and the car slides off t shoulder. Before he can regain control, Clayton's headed straight f

dialogues.speaker: AN ABANDONED FRUIT AND VEGETABLE STAND
dialogues.text: Clayton's car crashes through the stand -- flattening it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He blasts out on the other side, now sporting one busted  headlight and a dented grill. Somehow he manages to make back to the road, losing a hubcap on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) I said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up mike off  floor) I heard what you said. And I said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him cold) I don't care what you said. You're  from Texas and what you said don't  mean jack diddly here in Arkansas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton slams down the mike.

dialogues.speaker: ARKANSAS HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I whips around a treacherous bend in the highway,  leaving Sheriff Clayton in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE SHERIFF BRANFORD'S CAR
dialogues.text: The Arkansas Sheriff is mad. He spits his gum out the win but it's closed. The gum falls back in his lap. He looks it, then pops it back in his mouth again and turns to his Deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the Deputy can answer, Clayton's voice is back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio) This is Sheriff Clayton again. I  lost the Cobra, but he's deadheaded  toward you doing damn near 140. If I  was you I'd set up a roadblock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing mike) -- And if I was you, I wouldn't be  telling me what to do! Now take a  hike, buster!!! (he angrily hangs up  the mike and turns  to his Deputy) Block the road.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The two Arkansas Sheriff's cars slow down and form a  roadblock. Branford and his Deputy climb out of the car. Branford sp out his gum, as two other DEPUTIES climb out of the secon car. The four officers move behind their cars. To wait.

dialogues.speaker: A SPEEDOMETER
dialogues.text: The needle pressing 120. Ease back and we're:

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: as Bandit turns to Kate, who's looking out the rear windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit sighs relief, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) Bandit do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up mike) This is Bandit, you're coming in  long and strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) My handle's Silver Tongued Devil and  I'm here to tell you, your fellow  CB'ers are mighty proud of y'all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks much, Silver Tongued Devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) But I got a bad Bear story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit and Kate look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just rolled past a county mounty  roadblock down on eighty-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Thanks Silver Tongued Devil, we'll  avoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) Keep the wheels spinning and the  beavers grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Adios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to Silver  Tongued Devil) Classy guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit grins and takes a curve at 90. Then they both look up.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: The roadblock. No way around it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bandit looks ahead down both sides of the highway. Thinks quick.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: as Bandit I comes roaring down the highway headed directl for the roadblock. A farmhouse is off to the side, about hundred yards before the roadblock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit I swerves off the highway, throwing itself into a  broadside. The car lurches onto the Farmhouse driveway an barrels across the front yard. It snaps a clothesline ful of clothes, sending bras, panties, shirts and socks flyin in every direction. It then crashes through a chicken yard and corral fence,  sending whatever animals are available -- flying toward  freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit I roars across a fruit orchard, weaving in and  around rows and rows of trees, finally slamming onto an a road and back onto the highway -- way ahead of the roadbl

dialogues.speaker: BRANFORD AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: stand there like statues with their mouths hanging open. beat, then all four cops race toward their cars, leap in take off.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: a rattled Kate turns to Bandit. She's about to speak, but sees his intense concentration and says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR VIEW
dialogues.text: up ahead. Coming straight at them, down the center of the road -- another Arkansas Sheriff's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, it looks like a Smokey  convention.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bandit whips the wheel to the right and again, the Cobra airborne -- flying off the highway, careening down the  shoulder, through a creek and up onto another dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHERIFF'S CAR
dialogues.text: spins around in the middle of the highway -- almost flipp over in the process -- straightens out and takes off over the shoulder after Bandit I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: back to the highway. As Sheriff Branford's two Patrol car come blasting down the highway. They stop at the shoulder beat. Then they take off over the shoulder in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: back again. As Sheriff Clayton's Texas Highway Patrol car skids to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CLAYTON'S CAR
dialogues.text: Clayton surveys the situation. Bandit I roaring along the dirt road -- the three Arkansas Sheriff cars on his tail. makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) We'll meet again, Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he floors it taking off down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: THE DIRT ROAD
dialogues.text: as the three Arkansas Sheriff's cars race after Bandit I. They're on a treacherously narrow road. On both sides -- long sheer drop -- to water.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE SHERIFF BRANFORD'S CAR
dialogues.text: His Deputy is doing at least 80, as he pulls within a few feet of the lead car. The Deputy angrily honks his horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pass this fruit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just back off the hammer, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir, he's gonna get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't gonna get nothin' but a  brief mention in the obituary column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deputy turns to him, not understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) The bridge up ahead is out.

dialogues.speaker: THE NARROW DIRT ROAD
dialogues.text: The four cars kicking up dust for miles.

dialogues.speaker: CREEK
dialogues.text: where the dirt road ends. But the bridge that once crosse the banks -- is gone. A beat and Bandit I comes roaring straight toward the cre

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit and Kate see the creek. No bridge. End of the road Bandit barely has time to hit the brakes, sending the Cob into a wild fishtail. Kate desperately braces herself, ha onto the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit wheels the Cobra a full 360° and comes to a hal He looks back.

dialogues.speaker: HIS VIEW
dialogues.text: a half mile back, the Arkansas Sheriff's are coming on fa Sirens blasting. The choices are simple. Give up. Or jump the creek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Kate) Listen, we can either give up or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate holds the dashboard tighter and closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREEK
dialogues.text: Bandit slams the Cobra into first and takes off. Gears gr Tires screech.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: The speedometer whizzes past eighty. Bandit holds the whe tight. Kate takes a breath, then crosses herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit I blasts toward the embankment, hits the dirt  incline and suddenly is airborne.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREEK
dialogues.text: Bandit I in mid-air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit I sails over camera and comes crashing down on other side. They made it!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: as Bandit and Kate catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honeymoon would've never been  this exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We were planning on  seeing the Astrodome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit grins and as they take off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to the creek. As the first Sheriff's car comes roaring to the edge doing at least 95. He sees the bridge is out, hi his brakes, goes broadside and flies over the side -- int the creek. A beat and Sheriff Branford's car comes wailing down the  road. The Deputy slams down his brakes in the nick of tim and the car skids halfway over the edge -- hanging suspen in mid-air halfway over the creek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Third Sheriff's car comes barrelling down the road spots Branford's car hanging over the edge and brakes. Bu its rear end slings around, smashing into the rear of  Branford's car, sending it flying into the creek. A huge  splash, then:

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: as they roar off the dirt road, back onto the highway, Ba reaches for the CB mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Christ, what channel are we on?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit looks at Kate as she reaches under the seat for on of her errant cigarettes. Then, he punches in eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Bandit II. Bandit II. Give me a shout.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I AND II
dialogues.text: Cledus grabs the mike quickly. Fred has been gnawing on t corner of the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I hope that's you, buddy; 'cause I'd  hate to start believing in ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) What does the old Timex say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) She's losing minutes so you better  start running interference or we're  never gonna make it. Might I remind  you this was your brainstorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I'll drop off my fare, hit a quick  choke-and-puke and be blocking for  you pronto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate tries not to react to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Bandit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Yeah, guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Pick up a burger for Fred. He's going  crazy. (slaps Fred on the  butt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit puts the mike back and turns to Kate. Feels he sho say something. Before he can:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the man. Step on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit studies her for a moment, then stomps on it.

dialogues.speaker: A TRUCK STOP CAFE
dialogues.text: Bandit I pulls in between a row of eighteen-wheelers park in front of the cafe. A few Truckers, bragging about thei rigs, check out Bandit and Kate. They're especially taken with Kate's wedding gown. She and Bandit are oblivious to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Kate) The bus'll pick you up over there. (a beat) Uh... you got enough bread for a  ticket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to get to Jersey. I'll walk  the rest of the way. I've been sitting  a long time. (a beat) Nice meeting you. It's been a trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it was nothing) Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your Kenworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She offers her hand and they shake. Then, Bandit heads to the truck stop and Kate to the bus stop. He turns and loo back. She doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TRUCK STOP
dialogues.text: about fifteen Truckers inside. Buck Owens playing on the  juke box. Pinball machines going strong. Bandit walks in and crosses to the counter. A hot-looking WAITRESS with ratted hair and painted face stands in fron of a blackboard where the menu of the day is written. She straightens herself and crosses to Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming on) What's your pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Couple of cheeseburgers, no  condiments...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing on 'em and two cups of mud;  one while I'm waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit crosses to a booth, as a couple of TRUCKERS enter join another TRUCKER sitting in the booth next to Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Richmond; you look like  squirrel shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna drive fourteen hundred  miles for these cheap bastards? I  feel like leaving my rig in the middle  of the highway and tellin' them to  kiss my antenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean, good buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress comes over with Bandit's coffee. He pours in ton of sugar and stirs. As he takes a sip, he hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit whips around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. Standing in front of him -- sans wedding dress. She now wearing tight jeans and a denim shirt with the bottom rolled up and knotted above her midriff. She looks foxier than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a southern drawl) The bus ain't passin' through these  here parts for a piece. (sliding into booth) I know. You only have a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they sit across from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't take Master Charge so  I traded in my gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress comes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snippy; to Kate) Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit watches as she takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trucker coffee. It's three times  stronger. Good for a hundred miles.  That, a coupla perks, and you can  leap tall buildings in a single bound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling O.S.) Order up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gulps down a half a cup of coffee and rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ciao.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK WITH BANDIT
dialogues.text: moving quickly to the counter to pick up his order. Behin him; we notice one of the Truckers from the next booth ge up and crosses to Kate. Bandit reaches in his pocket to pay for the order:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seductive) Sure I can't interest you in anything  else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Another time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit picks up his order and turns toward the door. He s the Trucker talking to Kate. The Trucker's buddies have t around in their booth and are all over her. Bandit sets the food down on the counter and crosses to t booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Truckers) -- Believe me, fellas; I'd love to  schmoos, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so conceited. You don't  even know us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an ugly dude) To know us, is to love us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit steps between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how y'all doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, guys; I'm in a rush. Otherwise  I'd arrange it so they had to carry  you outta here in doggie bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and what goddamn army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Truckers all turn to Bandit, ready to mop the floor w him. The restaurant is silent, except for Willie Nelson, singing on the juke box. Every eye is on them. A brawl lo inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) Bandit, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally surprised,  almost yelling) Bandit?!? You're the Bandit? The  fella been runnin' the blue troopers  ragged?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit looks around self-consciously. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme shake your hand, boy! You're  my new goddamn idol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slapping Bandit on  the back) You're the rage of CB land. We been  followin' you for hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we'da known you was the Bandit,  we wouldn't a never lipped off to  your old lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she's not exactly my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping in) Lemme have your autograph, hoss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the restaurant crowds around Bandit and he st hurriedly signing autographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done twenty-eight Broadway shows  and no one's ever asked me for an  autograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the group, starting  off) Listen, guys, I gotta cover ground.  I'm due in Atlanta in less than ten  hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give our best to Jimmy Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate slips out of the booth, as Bandit crosses back to th counter.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER
dialogues.text: Bandit grabs his order and finds the OWNER facing him --  holding out Bandit's money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godspeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit smiles. Then starts out. He notices Kate is gone.  Shrugs. Heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE TRUCK STOP
dialogues.text: Bandit bolts out in time to see his Cobra pulling out, ab to take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit leaps off the steps and races toward the car, j as it peels out. He swings the passenger door open and is half in -- half out, as the Cobra skids out the truck sto over the curb and onto the highway. The door's still wide open. Bandit hanging on.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Kate's behind the wheel. She tromps on it and the car tak off like greased lightening. Bandit's struggling to stay the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hanging on) What the hell are you doing?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures over her  shoulder) He's after us again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate whips around a corner almost throwing Bandit onto th pavement. He grabs her arm and manages to pull himself in the car and slam the door. He looks back.

dialogues.speaker: HIS VIEW
dialogues.text: Sheriff Clayton's Texas Highway Patrol car is after them  again. Siren blasting.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bandit turns to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this guy, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (driving hard, eyes  on the road) I've never seen him before in my  life. I'm just trying to help you  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By stealing my car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would've come back for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not believing) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to him, dead  serious) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wraps a corner doing 60, hits the highway and puts it the floor. Clayton's battered up car is still coming on  strong.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CLAYTON'S CAR
dialogues.text: Sheriff Clayton's eyes are glazed as he tears after Bandi I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I'm gonna get you, you dirty,  stinking, rotten sumbitch.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BANDIT
dialogues.text: Kate at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the truth is, I didn't want to  be dumped at the truck stop. I wanted  to go on with you. I needed an excuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might have said no. I have trouble  handling rejection.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I streaks past, Kate driving. A beat and a big rig hauling a crane comes out of a side road. The truck moves slowly down the highway -- a wide load.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CLAYTON'S CAR
dialogues.text: roaring up.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: Clayton floors it and hunches low over the wheel as he pa the truck -- afraid the crane's going to take off his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sheriff Clayton's car zooms under the crane, clearing by a hair. But the crane rips off Clayton's lights and si Leaving only wires and a gaping hole in the roof of the c

dialogues.speaker: ARKANSAS HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I streaking. Kate takes a dangerous curve doing 85 Bandit gasps, but Kate holds her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you learn how to drive  like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first father was a redneck. He  taught me how to drive fast and pants  people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit picks up the CB mike, flicking the crystal selecto two stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Breaker, this is Bandit I, how are  your vocal cords?

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I AND II
dialogues.text: Cledus takes his mike. Fred is on all fours in the now ch up front seat. Bouncing around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) My vocal cords are fine, but Fred's  ain't. He's been barking, eating the  seats and driving me crackers. (Fred barks) Hear that? Where's his chow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) On its way. Give me a coupla minutes,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Do I have a choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) What's your twenty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) 'Bout fourteen miles this side of  Mississippi.

dialogues.speaker: CLEDUS' VIEW
dialogues.text: up ahead -- an Arkansas Highway Patrol car is parked off the side, hidden by a clump of Magnolia Trees.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Cledus brings it down to 55 and rolls past TWO OFFICERS  standing next to their car, holding a radar gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I just passed two Kojacks with a  Kodak. (then) Man, this highway's crawling with  Bears. Ain't no way we gonna make  Atlanta on time without you runnin'  blocker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit looks back over his shoulder. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I'm still trying to ditch this Texas  Smokey. I don't know what the sucker  wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) What they all want -- to handcuff a  hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) As far as John Law knows, I'm just a  joy ridin' Georgia redneck. We keep  'em outta your backyard, we're cool. (looking back again) Now just give me five to ditch this  idiot and I'll meet you in Ole Miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) If you don't, we can kiss that  Kenworth good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit replaces the mike, glances up to the rear view.

dialogues.speaker: HIS VIEW
dialogues.text: Sheriff Clayton -- gaining ground.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: They're speeding around curves now, Kate doing her best t control the Cobra. She takes a corner too fast and too wi Bandit I drifts into the oncoming lane and suddenly they' staring at:

dialogues.speaker: A CAMPER
dialogues.text: coming straight at them. A Mother, Father and Two Childre all riding in the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate swerves back into her lane, avoiding a head-on by le than a split second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should switch seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his hands on the steering wheel and his foot on t accelerator, but he and Kate get tangled up trying to mak the switch. The car goes out of control -- smashes into a guard raili and bounces back onto the highway. They try to switch again. Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fastening seat belt) You go ahead. This seat's more  comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I streaking, followed in the distance by the Texas Highway Patrol car. Coming down the highway, from the opposite direction -- i long, long, long FUNERAL PROCESSION. Suddenly, Bandit I swerves to the right and starts across the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mississippi's the other way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to lose this putz or not?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Bandit I zips between two limos heading the Fu Procession, crosses the highway, sails over the embankmen and swerves onto a bumpy dirt path.
