dialogues.speaker: CAMERA WHIPS BACK
dialogues.text: to Sheriff Clayton's car -- roaring straight at us.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CLAYTON'S CAR
dialogues.text: Sheriff Clayton spots Bandit I across the highway, flying down the bumpy dirt path. He hits his brakes and the car  screeches to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON
dialogues.text: forced to sit and wait, as the Funeral Procession passes  slowly by. He's livid. Lays on the horn.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: as the vehicles in the passing lane are all forced to com to a halt to avoid crashing into Clayton -- who sits in t middle of the highway waiting for the endless Funeral  Procession to pass. Horns honk. People yell. Clayton wait

dialogues.speaker: THE BUMPY DIRT PATH
dialogues.text: Bandit I bounces along, past rows and rows of tall Magnol trees.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Kate and Bandit bouncing from seat to ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motor-mouthing) -- You know, I used to be a high  fashion model. Tried it for six months  and almost freaked. Makeup, silly  clothes, a little man saying 'darling'  every two seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's tough when your cheek- bones are your main asset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, then sees  something O.S.) Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: up ahead. The path ends. There's an incline and past that long low fence. There's no way around or past it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kate and Bandit look back. The Funeral Procession has alm passed. Clayton's is waiting. Gunning his engine. He ain' giving up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'd better let me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Bandit can finish, Kate trounces on it, driving  straight toward the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit I blasts toward the incline, hits it doing 70 a sails over the fence.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER SIDE OF THE FENCE
dialogues.text: we HEAR the CRACK of a baseball bat and a CENTER FIELDER, full uniform, takes off after a long fly ball. He stops i his tracks at what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit I flies over the fence and lands in the middle a MINOR LEAGUE BASEBALL GAME. The Center Fielder is absolutely flabbergasted, as Kate  straightens out the Shelby Cobra and takes off across the baseball field. She roars over second base and does a 360° fishtail in th middle of the pitchers mound. PLAYERS scatter in every  direction.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING
dialogues.text: as Kate speeds past the dugout and a CHEERING CROWD, back an access road. Up ahead. The highway. And safety.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Kate looks over to Bandit, a huge grin on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baseball needs a little pizzazz.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Funeral Procession finally passes and Clayton zooms a the highway and onto the bumpy dirt path.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE DIRT PATH
dialogues.text: Sheriff Clayton's car comes to a sliding halt in front of the fence. He looks around for some sign of Bandit I. Not They've vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) This is beginning to piss me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The path is far too narrow to turn around, so as he begin the arduous chore of driving in reverse down the long nar path, knocking off his remaining hub caps on the way, we:

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY SIGN
dialogues.text: reading Welcome to Mississippi. A black streak whizzes pa

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Kate still at the wheel. Bandit on the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) -- Gimme a twenty, pardner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) I'm at marker eight-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Son-of-a-gun. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT II
dialogues.text: moving along the highway. Cledus looks out the sideview w of the big eighteen-wheeler.

dialogues.speaker: HIS VIEW
dialogues.text: Bandit I coming up to his back door.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: as Cledus signals with his arm and pulls the, rig off to side of the road. The door opens and Cledus climbs down the metal steps of truck, followed by Fred. They both take a long, healthy  stretch, as Bandit I pulls to a stop behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit and Kate get out of the Cobra. Cledus is surprised see her. She immediately crosses to him and offers her ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Kate. You must be Cledus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking hands,  awkwardly) Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your twenty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus doesn't get it. Bandit laughs, unwraps the hamburg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the hamburger out for the dog, who wolfs it down one bite, then goes off to relieve himself. Cledus takes Bandit by the arm and pulls him aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were dumping the chick  at the truck stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran into complications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to say it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling on) -- But everytime we've ever messed  up, it's because your rhyme's over- ruling your reason. I know you think  you're God's gift to waitresses,  but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interupts) Just don't worry about it. (then) How we doin' timewise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good enough to be standing here  shooting the bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to leave) We're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to Kate) Nice ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit grins, moves to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whistles to Kate) Let's hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing to Bandit I) Nice meeting you, Cledus. Keep on  truckin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus smiles, as Bandit and Kate climb into the Cobra. B starts the engine and they're off. Cledus pulls a crowbar out of the rig and begins hitting his tires. Checking them out. As he does this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Let's roll, Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus finishes the tires, but Fred isn't moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. The dog stares at him. Cledus takes a step forwa Fred takes a step backward. Cledus takes two steps forwar And Fred takes off. Running through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running after him) Fred!!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: rolling. They're silent for a long time. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You plan on driving trucks all your  life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, actually I was thinking of  becoming a brain surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs, as we:

dialogues.speaker: CLEDUS CHASING FRED
dialogues.text: through the woods. As he's about to nab him, the Dog cuts right and Cledus sprawls left.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Kate and Bandit. Talking. More relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Trucking ain't the easiest life  in the world. I mean, you can't make  it much past fifty and you sure as  shit don't get a gold watch when you  hang it all up. But I like keeping  on the move. You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know? I'm an authority on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess if there's one lesson I've  learned, it's that even misery has a  tough time hitting a moving target. (then, realizing) I forgot your question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You plan on driving trucks all your  life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I... uh... I don't know. I guess  don't like to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's change the subject. (a beat) What do you think about forced school  busing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And:

dialogues.speaker: CLEDUS RACING AFTER FRED
dialogues.text: gaining ground. A flying tackle. And he snares him. Cledu is out of breath and pissed. Fred licks his face.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit spots a green sedan with a radio-mike antenna comi in the other direction. He backs off the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your foot fall asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit shakes his head, reaching for the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Bandit two, Smokey in a plain brown  wrapper coming your way. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer from Cledus. Kate has no idea what Bandit's jus said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining to Kate) An unmarked police car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (into mike) Bandit two, bring yourself on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) What's the matter, Cledus? You got  mike fright? (a beat, then) Bandit two, do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I AND II
dialogues.text: Cledus, exhausted and sweaty, tosses Fred into the eighte wheeler and lunges for the CB mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Yeah, yeah, yeah? What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit glances up in the rear view mirror, sees the Smoke in a plain wrapper take an off ramp. Harmless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Never mind. It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Anything else you don't want me to  know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Nope. Just keep those wheels churning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus hangs up the mike, starts his rig, checks for onco and pulls onto the highway. Fred's head sticks out the wi his ears flapping in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I and Bandit II whizzing down the highway. Picking time. OVER this, Kate sings "Jolene" along with Dolly Par on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit notices a broken-down FORD with its hood up, parke off the highway. He veers the Cobra off the road, quickly opens the glove compartment, takes out two screwdrivers a hands one to Kate. She stops singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining) I'm sure the Arkansas Bears put out  an all-points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening door) You take the front, I'll take the  back.

dialogues.speaker: A MISSISSIPPI LICENSE PLATE
dialogues.text: fills the screen. Then the screeching of burning rubber a Bandit I pulls away from camera -- now wearing the Missis plates. And we:

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF LAP DISSOLVES
dialogues.text: Bandit I running blocker for Bandit II. Hauling ass. OVER this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thick Mississippi  drawl) All units, be on the look out for a  black 1976 Shelby Cobra, Georgia  license...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as the voice FADES, we:

dialogues.speaker: MISSISSIPPI HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Later. Bandit I and II. Rolling. Over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit two, I gotta make a quick pit  stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're outta motion lotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep streaking. Pick me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit I takes an off ramp, as Bandit II continues sailin down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: UNION 76 STATION
dialogues.text: off the main highway. Bandit I pulls up to one of several islands in the large station. Trucks are gassing up at va pumps.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Kate climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save my seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts toward the Ladies Room as a young BLACK ATTEND struts up to Bandit I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Cobra: what's your pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the hood, my man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit shakes his head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw right. This is a clean machine.  Yeah, I was thinking 'bout getting  me one of these myself. But I figure  I'm conspicuous enough to the police  as it is, so why encourage them more,  if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attendant starts pumping Supreme. Bandit leans back i the seat. Closes his eyes. Suddenly, from his CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Bandit, do you read me? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit snaps his eyes open. Who the hell is this? He grab his mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) This is Bandit. Who we got on that  end?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CLAYTON
dialogues.text: The Texas Sheriff looks tired -- obsessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Just the man who's gonna see you  driven to your knees! Sheriff Buell  Clayton from Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Not that I don't have any respect  for the law, but what's your problem,  man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Yeah, well I kinda figured that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) You know, you may think you're gonna  get away, but I promise you, everytime  you turn around, I'll be there,  breathing down your neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Well, if your breath is as sweet as  your personality, I got a lot to  look forward to. Adios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit hangs up the mike, as Kate comes back sipping an o soda. She hops into the front seat, as the Attendant stru back over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as camera begins to slowly PULL AWAY from Bandit I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bandit) That'll be eight-seventy two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit hands him a bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Outta ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera has now PULLED BACK enough to see:

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CLAYTON'S CAR
dialogues.text: parked on the other side of the gas station. The car's fr end has been lifted high into the air by a hydraulic jack and ANOTHER ATTENDANT is changing a tire and replacing a  broken headlight. Clayton sits in the battered Sheriff's car, having no ide Bandit I is in the very same station.

dialogues.speaker: THE GAS STATION
dialogues.text: as Bandit gets his change from the ATTENDANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bandit) Have a smooth one, Cobra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit nods, throws the Cobra into gear, takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit I sails right past the Texas Sheriff's car.

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON
dialogues.text: His head whips around, when he sees Bandit I roar out of station back back onto the highway. He's absolutely stunn

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Clayton starts his engine and stomps on it... totally  forgetting his front end is up on jacks. Clayton's car ta off on its rear wheels, sails halfway across the gas stat and slams head-on into a BRAND NEW CONTINENTAL. As the Continental sails across the islands:

dialogues.speaker: ON CLAYTON
dialogues.text: Watching in horror. Then, trying to compose himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) It's all right. It's not your car.  You're doing fine. Just keep going.

dialogues.speaker: MISSISSIPPI HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I roars back onto blacktop. Hammer down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Looks like a clear shot to the  'Bama State Line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll believe it when I see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of a long expanse of Mississippi Highway. Bandit I gainin ground and finally roaring past Bandit II. Running blocke Over this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Breaker. Breaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick it up, Breaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the break. Bandit, this  here's the Dixie Chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Dixie Chicken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask if he delivers?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been hearin' all 'bout y'all and  wanted to let y'all know, y'all got  the Mississippi Bears eatin' their  badges. They can't find hide nor  hair of y'all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bandit I disappears around a bend in the highway, with Bandit II following in the distance, we:

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER SECTION OF THE MISSISSIPPI HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: close to the Alabama State Line. Hilly. Empty. Suddenly,  from over the top of a hill, comes Bandit I. As it races  toward camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- This is Sheriff Buell Clayton,  Texas Highway Patrol. That Cobra  y'all been lookin' for with Georgia  plates, ain't got no more Georgia  plates. She's now running with  Mississippi tags. Charles. Alan.  Richard. Two. Seven. Three. Vehicle  now southbound on Interstate 82.  Heading for Alabama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thick drawl) -- That's a big ten-four, Texas.  Now, we gonna nail that joy ridin'  sumbitch.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Kate finds another stray cigarette under the seat and lig it, as they speed toward the Alabama State Line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only smoked three cigarettes  through the entire state of  Mississippi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, something grabs them O.S.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: Three MISSISSIPPI HIGHWAY PATROL CARS. Lights swirling. F in a solid roadblock. Waiting for Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-byes are always tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He immediately swerves the wheel to the right and makes a sliding turn off the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The countryside. As Bandit I blasts across a grassy knoll and heads toward a steep hill.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY PATROL CARS
dialogues.text: as they take off after Bandit I. Sirens screaming.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit slams the Cobra into first and starts up the steep grassy hill. There's no path. No road. He's got to make h own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit I and the Three Mississippi Highway Patrol cars ro up the steep hill. Climbing. Higher. Higher.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOP OF THE HILL
dialogues.text: Bandit I rolls over the top.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: as Bandit and Kate look over the other side. Almost strai down. Treacherous. They look back.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR VIEW
dialogues.text: The Three Mississippi Highway Patrol cars coming on stron

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bandit trounces on it and the Cobra sails over the top an starts down the incline.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: of the roller coaster ride down. Bandit and Kate's stomac dropping to their toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the First Highway Patrol car reaches the top -- and wi braking -- blasts over, sailing straight into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Highway Patrol car crashes down on its two front whee Flips. And rolls end-over-end down the steep incline. Cra into a tree, halfway down.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOP OF THE HILL
dialogues.text: As the Second Mississippi Highway Patrol car almost makes to the top, its wheels start spinning in the thick grass. The Driver loses it -- and suddenly, the car starts rolli backward, down the steep hill. Out of control.

dialogues.speaker: THE THIRD HIGHWAY PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: whips around the Second, as it rolls right past him -- do 60 per in reverse. The Third car makes it to the top of the incline. Waits.  Looks down.

dialogues.speaker: HIS VIEW
dialogues.text: The steep incline. The First Highway Patrol car halfway d on its back. Out of it. And Bandit I. Roaring down the hill. Toward freedom.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As the Third Highway Patrol car makes a decision, flies o the top. And starts tearing after Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit I reaches the bottom of the hill, makes a slidi turn onto a rocky road running alongside a stream. As he roars down the road, the lone Mississippi Highway P car reaches the bottom of the hill, slides onto the road takes off in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROAD
dialogues.text: Bandit I screaming down the road, the Mississippi Highway Patrol car on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) Pull over, Bandit. This road's a  dead end. It's all over for you,  boy!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit looks up ahead. The son-of-a-bitch is right. Dead  end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bandit immediately wheels the Cobra over the embankmen down the other side, into the stream. He punches it and a water covers the Cobra, Bandit roars through the stream,  swerving the wheel to the right, staying on rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Highway Patrol car comes reeling over the embankment splashes into the stream. It takes off after Bandit I, hi a rock, goes broadside and slides into deep water. Stuck.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: Water rising to the car's window, the OFFICER watches  helplessly, as Bandit bumps across the stream, over the  shoulder, back onto the highway and into the state of Ala Leaving only thirty feet of rubber to remember him by.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: As Bandit I disappears into the Alabama mountains. A beat, and a big eighteen-wheeler rolls across the state line. Bandit II. Doing a cool 55. Georgia bound.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALABAMA MOUNTAINS
dialogues.text: Bandit I weaves through the mountains. Taking turns fast. Making time. Passing signs that read: Curves Ahead, Slipp When Wet, Slow, etc. Bandit II is keeping pace. Smokestacks blasting.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALABAMA/MISSISSIPPI STATE LINE
dialogues.text: A TOW TRUCK is pulling the Mississippi Highway Patrol car out of the drink, while a REPAIR CREW attempts to turn ov the Highway Patrol car stuck halfway up the hill. TWO ADDITIONAL TOW TRUCKS stand by, waiting to haul off t other Patrol cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Clayton's car comes driving up. Its front end is totalled and the front window is shattered.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CLAYTON'S CAR
dialogues.text: Sheriff Clayton sees the commotion, pulls his car across highway and parks. He climbs out, leaving the front door  open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching Tow Truck  Driver) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton looks out over the mess. Winces. Suddenly, a giant EIGHTEEN-WHEELER, hauling a wide load o lumber comes barrelling down the highway. Clayton's door still standing open and the Eighteen-wheeler rips the "Te Sheriff's" door right off its hinges, sending it soaring  thirty feet into the air.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE EIGHTEEN-WHEELER
dialogues.text: A TRUCKER with a flattop grins to himself. Cops. Fuck 'em

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Taking the curves. Holding the shoulder. Kate is lying ba in the seat with her eyes closed. From the radio, Charlie Rich sings, "Behind Closed Doors." Bandit drives. Hums al Rain drops begin hitting the windshield. Bandit flips on wipers and reaches for his CB. Turns it two stops. Now, t rain really comes down. An Alabama thundershower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Bandit two, come on.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I AND II
dialogues.text: Fred sleeps with his head on Cledus' lap. Cledus picks up his CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I'm all ears, good buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) You're gonna hit some heavy  precipitation in about six minutes.  Better let your flaps down, these  roads are killers when they're damp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike, checking  fuel gauge) It shouldn't last. Gives me time to  take a go-go juice break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) We'll be waiting. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit hangs up the mike and pulls the Cobra to a stop un a clump of trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up) Are we in Atlanta already?

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT II
dialogues.text: Cledus spots a truck stop up ahead and backs off the hamm

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK STOP
dialogues.text: as the eighteen-wheeler pulls in front of a gasoline pump Cledus opens the door, climbs down the metal steps and  stretches his legs. He motions for the ATTENDANT to fill up, then starts toward the restaurant, passing a couple o rigs and a long row of chromed choppers parked in front.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TRUCK STOP
dialogues.text: four greasy walls. And that's about it except for an old, beaten-up pool table. Cledus enters followed by Fred. As  usual, the jukebox is playing. This time, it's "Baby Boy" Mary Kay Place. About a dozen people sitting around, seven of which are b looking BIKERS and their MAMAS. Cledus crosses to the cou He's greeted by the OWNER, a fat black man. There's a CB the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme three sloppy joes and a coupla  cups of hot stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking order) You pass that funky Cobra on the  highway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. What Cobra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some boy named Bandit's been givin'  the Highway Patrol shit fits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Good for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where he's goin' or  what he's doin', but I sure hope to  God he makes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus grins, then crosses to the pay phone. Fred tags al

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: pulled off the highway. Rain glistens off the windshield. Time stands still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been thinking. Maybe I should drop  you in Montgomery. I mean, the way  things are going, it might get pretty  hairy by the time we get to Atlanta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. This is one of the longest  relationships I've ever had. I'm not  blowing it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins. From the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from radio) I'm gonna dedicate this next one to  a man out there who's capturing the  hearts of us all. Hey, Bandit; take  care of yourself and your woman.  Hear? It's raining out and the Red- Headed Stranger's singing this one  especially for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And from the radio, Willie Nelson sings, "Blue Eyes Cryin In The Rain." Bandit and Kate look at each other for a lo moment...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TRUCK STOP
dialogues.text: Cledus is talking on the phone, Fred waiting nearby. A BI waits to use the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey, pumpkin pie, how you doin'? I  should be home real soon. Yeah, Fred's  fine. Still po'ed? See, time heals  all wounds. Anyway, just wanted to  check in. Okay, sweetie. You too.  Bye-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man; this your goddam mutt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just bit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred? C'mon, man; he don't bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus begins walking back toward the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said the mother bit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn'ta bit you. He's got better  taste than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter O.S. Suddenly, the Biker tries kicking Fred. Fre leaps back. Baring his teeth. Scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, back off, huh!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animals like this should be put to  sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's put the poor little  sumbitch outta his misery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other bikers chime in their approval, as the First Bi takes a pool cue off the wall rack and starts toward Fred

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Hey, pal; I told you. Cut that shit  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Biker isn't listening. He starts to swing the cue Fred, but Cledus whirls and slams his fist into the Biker pock-marked face blowing him into the jukebox. The record skips and jumps to Merle Haggard's "live version" of "Oki From Muskogee." Loud. Instantly, the other bikers are on their feet. A TRUCKER  stands to help Cledus and is immediately cold-cocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus sees he's in the middle of a powder keg -- with no way out. He backs up toward the pool table, grabs a cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Hey, c'mon fellas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus swings the pool cue. The bikers split up. Move aro him. He can't watch them all. Then like clockwork, they a rush him. Three from the front, two from the side, one ov the top of the pool table. Cledus nails one of them with a pool cue to the nuts. The Biker screams and doubles over. A Biker flies over the po table and crashes into Cledus from behind -- knocking the pool cue away. Another Biker rushes in, but gets Cledus'  Frye Boot in the gut for his trouble. But then the other two nail Cledus from each side and it' over. They've got him. Cledus tries to shake himself loos but the First Biker, picks himself up from the jukebox,  strolls over and lets him have it twice in the groin. Cle doubles over. Onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the three bikers pick Cledus up and toss him into the  air, over to the other three bikers. They catch him and t him back again. A beat, then they run toward the window, still carrying  Cledus. They swing him back and forth. One. Two. Three. T they toss him out the window.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE TRUCK STOP
dialogues.text: Glass shatters, as Cledus comes flying through the window landing face down in the gravel. With a thud. Wait. And F is tossed out after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus slowly pulls himself up, trying to hold back his a and humiliation. He begins walking. Fred follows. Camera  stays:

dialogues.speaker: ON CLEDUS
dialogues.text: as he starts toward Bandit II. He passes something off-sc The trace of a smile crosses his face. He keeps walking. From O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's seventy-three eighty-four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stay CLOSE on Cledus, as he reaches into his pocket an hands the Attendant some bills off-camera. Doesn't break  stride. We're still close. Tracking. A few more steps and a bag ENTERS FRAME. Cledus takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay me next time through, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus nods, takes the bag. Keeps walking. Up to the truc Climbing the steps.

dialogues.speaker: THRU WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: Cledus settles into the truck. Fred climbs over him, into the shotgun position. HOLD on  Cledus, as he fires up the big eighteen-wheeler. He glanc again at something off-screen. And his smile becomes a li wider.

dialogues.speaker: THE GEARSHIFT
dialogues.text: Cledus' gloved hand jams the big rig into gear. The truck leaps forward. And now:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the eighteen-wheeler, as it roars toward the long line Chromed Choppers -- knocking them to the ground and rolli right over them. Crunch!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching Bandit II, as it keeps on rolling. Out of the pa lot and back onto the highway. Leaving behind:

dialogues.speaker: THE CHOPPERS
dialogues.text: Complete wrecks. Chrome. Mirrors. Fenders. Tires. All cru and mutilated. These bikes will never ride again.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit II, rolling. Over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit I, bring yourself in.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit and Kate kissing. The first time. Tenderly. The ra has turned to a light drizzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) Bandit I, do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit and Kate break the kiss. Look at each other. Bandi reaches for the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) We're listening, Bandit II. Back.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I AND II
dialogues.text: Cledus feels better. He's eating a sloppy joe with one ha and driving with the other. The two cups of coffee are re in coffee holders, attached to the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Ran into a little hassle at the eatum- up-stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Just fine. What's the weather like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) God's back on our side, so let's get  smokin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Roger. Keep the shiny side up and  the greasy side down. (then) Right, Fred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred barks. Cledus drives on, more determined than ever.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit fires up the Cobra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout one more for the road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit turns to her and they kiss again. And we:

dialogues.speaker: THE ALABAMA MOUNTAINS
dialogues.text: The roads are slick, but Bandit I and II take them hard a fast. Over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) -- How we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) It's gonna be close. Real close.

dialogues.speaker: ALABAMA HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: as Bandit I and II come rolling down the mountain. Onto t main highway. Over this from the radio, Doug Kershaw play mean fiddle.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: A little later. Bandit and Kate talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more relaxed) -- Actually, my heaviest relationship  was with a rock singer named Ramblin'  Bobby Holt. When I turned twenty- one, I went to Europe with visions  of being free and independent. My  luck, he was on the plane. I landed  in Paris and fell in love before I  could claim my baggage. (a beat) We were together for almost a year.  I thought he was it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't. One day I came home and  found him taking a shower -- with  another girl. And her sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit whistles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My very words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's what you get for falling  in love with a guy who's first name  is Ramblin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate laughs, then:

dialogues.speaker: ALABAMA HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I roars up behind a long line of cars and campers, crawling along at the prescribed 65.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit looking ahead. Trying to figure something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should arrest people for obeying  the speed limit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up CB mike) Bandit II?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) We're gonna have to do a little  tightrope act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's boogie.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit pulls into the oncoming lane and roars past half a dozen cars and campers, before sliding back in. A beat an he's off again.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I
dialogues.text: as Bandit I pulls out, the VW in front of him pulls out t forcing Bandit I to swerve around him and onto the should Bandit floors it, roars along the shoulder and around the VW. Bandit I continues passing cars, until he's forced back i the correct lane by an oncoming yellow school bus.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit flicks the CB selector over two channels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Kate. You clock it and  let Cledus know when this school bus  goes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate fires up the mike. The school bus comes closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Bandit two, you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) You're soundin' real bodacious. Back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The school bus passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) A yellow school bus just flew past  us. I'll count up to closing time --  starting... Now. 27, 28, 29, 30,  31...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate keeps her eyes on the road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I rolling down the highway. Kate counting OVER:

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: as she continues counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black Porsche rounds the curve in the oncoming lane.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT II
dialogues.text: Cledus speeding down the oncoming lane. Both hands grippi the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) ...48... 49... Here comes a black  Porsche. Pull in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus looks for a place to squeeze in. The traffic is bu to-bumper. He stomps on it.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit II racing down the oncoming lane looking for an  opening. And here comes the black Porsche. Straight at hi Finally, Cledus spots an opening and wheels the big rig i an instant before the black Porsche whizzes by.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT II
dialogues.text: Cledus sighs relief. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Here we go again, Bandit II.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus puts the hammer to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: as the big eighteen-wheeler pulls back into the oncoming  lane and takes off. Camera eases back to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the Alabama Highway. Bumper-to-bumper traffic in one l Bandit I followed in the distance by Bandit II blasting d the oncoming lane doing at least 100 MPH. Again Doug Kershaw plays OVER...

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CLAYTON'S CAR
dialogues.text: now almost a complete wreck. The inside of the car is soa wet, as is the Texas Sheriff. No time to get a new front  door. Clayton is having trouble seeing through the shattered  windshield and runs right over a boulder that's fallen on the highway... leaving his complete exhaust system laying the middle of the highway. And now, the ROAR from his eng is deafening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the battered-up Texas Sheriff's car comes wailing thro the mountains and descends to meet:

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAFFIC JAM
dialogues.text: backed up for miles. Clayton pulls up behind the endless  line of cars and campers Bandit I and Bandit II long ago  passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning on horn) Goddammit. I'm in a goddam hurry,  goddammit!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton continues slamming down on his horn, but no one  budges. Resigned, he removes his hand from the horn. But horn keeps blaring. Stuck. As the car horn and engine continue blasting, we:

dialogues.speaker: ALABAMA HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I and II moving down the bullet lane. Deadheading  home. Over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It's hard to believe this schmuck  Kyle would go to such lengths for  Coors beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the beer. He just wants to  see me fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a guy is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minute you see him, you'll know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug Kershaw plays again, and we:

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit picks up the CB mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) This is Bandit. I'm about twenty- five miles outside of Georgia. Heading  in on Eighty-five and looking for a  Smokey report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) This is First Madame, Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE A MOBILE HOME
dialogues.text: Tacky. Colored candles and incense burning. Stained glass contact paper over the windows. Sitting at a bar in the front of the trailer, sipping Old Grandad, is FIRST MADAME. Platinum hair and a see-through negligee. She's talking into a CB mike. Behind her, in silhouette, ANOTHER WOMAN in a negligee is undressing TWO MEN in uniform. As she removes their hats, ties, belts, shirts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) We knew you'd be coming our way and  decided to take care of the Bears  for you. You know, a little  personalized roadside service.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY, (DIALOGUE OVERLAPS)
dialogues.text: A PINK MOBILE HOME sits back from the highway, sporting a very long CB antenna. Two signs rest in the front window: "Truckers Only" and "Love Gas For Sale." Parked in front of the trailer, are TWO ALABAMA STATE TRO CARS. As Bandit I whips past:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send me the bill, First Madame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better yet. Why don't you pay up in  person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll catch you on the flip- flop. Over and out.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Kate turns to him. Shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, she's got a heart of  gold.

dialogues.speaker: A HIGHWAY SIGN
dialogues.text: reading: Georgia -- 20 Miles. A blur passes camera. Bandi I. Then a much longer blur. Bandit II.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Kate and Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do when you get  home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep for a week. (then) Wanna join me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, she leans across the seat and kisses him.  Passionately. He goes with it.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: As they kiss, the Cobra veers off the highway -- out of  control. It swerves back onto the highway, across the onc lane, then back toward the shoulder. As Bandit I weaves w down the highway, it passes:

dialogues.speaker: AN ALABAMA STATE TROOPER'S CAR
dialogues.text: The TWO TROOPERS inside exchange a quick look, hit their  siren and take off.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Kate and Bandit break the kiss when they hear the siren.  Bandit glances up in the rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She punches him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Alabama State Trooper chasing Bandit I.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit spots a SIX TRUCK CONVOY moving up ahead. The rear truck is hauling gasoline. There are several cars between Bandit and the Convoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Breaker, Breaker. This is Bandit I,  coming up on a portable gas station.  Do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) Bandit, this is Mister B, and I'm  gearjamming this rolling refinery.  You got another Smokey on the rubber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) What else? (then) Can you give me cover, Mister B?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) Come head on, Bandit. We'll slip you  into the rocking chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit looks up in the rear view.

dialogues.speaker: HIS VIEW
dialogues.text: The Alabama State Trooper is weaving in and out of traffi after Bandit. Blue lights swirling.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Bandit floorboards it, passing THREE CARS and sliding bac into traffic, an instant before oncoming traffic whizzes A beat and he's back into the oncoming lane. Passing anot FOUR CARS and heading toward the Six Truck Convoy.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HIM
dialogues.text: The Alabama State Trooper passes the First Three Cars and darts back into line, as Bandit comes back out.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I roars up to the Convoy, the Six Trucks break ran leaving an opening in the middle. Bandit I passes the first Three Trucks and slips into the Convoy. The Trucks all close ranks around Bandit I.

dialogues.speaker: ALABAMA STATE TROOPER'S CAR
dialogues.text: as it comes up to the back door of the Convoy. The Troope passes Trucks Six and Five, but Truck Four pulls out of t Convoy, as if to pass, just in front of the Alabama State Trooper. The Trooper's car is forced off the highway, onto the  shoulder. He floors it, passing the Convoy -- unaware tha Truck Four has just hidden Bandit. As the Trooper barrels down the highway, Truck Four pulls back into the Convoy.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit pulls out of the Convoy, passing the Three Lead Tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Mister B, I don't know how to thank  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) Thank me by not getting caught.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT II
dialogues.text: Cledus has the hammer down. Drinking coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) Bandit II?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus picks up his mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I'm all ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from CB) You're about to hit a convoy. Tighten  up your rubber band. The oncoming's  clear.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: as the big eighteen-wheeler takes the oncoming lane and l her roll. As he roars past the Convoy, he gives a long BL on his HORN to each of the trucks as he passes. Each truc responds with a BLAST.

dialogues.speaker: THE GEORGIA STATE LINE
dialogues.text: The Alabama State Trooper who chased Bandit is parked off the highway at the Alabama/Georgia State Line. The Trooper climbs out of his car, to stretch his legs. H unhooks his pistol, sits on the fender of his car. Waits. A beat and he hears a HORN honking way off in the distanc He looks up to his left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit I zooming across the state line on a high road, ab the highway. A hand waves to the Trooper from the Cobra.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The Trooper is furious. But before he can do anything, he practically blown off his fender by a huge eighteen-wheel blasting across the state line. Bandit II. Heading home.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: Bandit I roars through the lush Georgia mountains and hea back toward two lane blacktop. He hits the highway, just ahead of Bandit II. And they're off.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGIA EXPRESSWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I and Bandit II fly past a sign announcing: The Pe Tree Classic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot Lanta, here we come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we:

dialogues.speaker: A GEORGIA STATE WEIGHT STATION
dialogues.text: Two GEORGIA HIGHWAY PATROL CARS are parked at the Weight  Station. Several TRUCKS move across the scales, down the  ramp and back onto the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to Bandit I coming down the highway toward the Weight Sta

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit sees the scales, slows and pulls off to the side o the road. He lets his motor idle, waiting for Cledus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you stopping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weight Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks over the crystal selector another two notches a keys the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Bandit II?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) You're coming up to the scale house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) I'm cucumber cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bandit II rolls past them, heading up the ramp toward the Weight Station.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT II
dialogues.text: Cledus waits, as an eighteen-wheeler, hauling mobile home rolls onto the scales. Cledus glances over to the:

dialogues.speaker: THE WEIGHT STATION SHACK
dialogues.text: TWO WEIGHT STATION WORKERS are inside. One is checking th scales, the other is rapping with TWO GEORGIA HIGHWAY  PATROLMEN.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: as the eighteen-wheeler is weighed. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) Okay, you're clear to roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver moves off the scales, back onto the highway. C eases Bandit II into first and moves onto the scales.

dialogues.speaker: CLEDUS
dialogues.text: waiting. Takes off his gloves. Wipes his hands on his ves A little nervous. He glances up at the Station house.

dialogues.speaker: HIS VIEW
dialogues.text: The Weight Station Worker is talking to the Georgia heat. The Worker then moves to the loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) Pull 'er ahead and park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Cledus leans across Fred and rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling through window) What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other WORKER starts out of the shack, followed by one the Georgia Highway Patrolmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) Just pull it over, please. And have  your manifest ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Oh, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus pulls the big eighteen-wheeler off the scales and  into the inspection area. The other Weight Station Worker and the Georgia Cop appro the truck. Cledus hands them his manifest. The Weight Sta Worker checks it out. The Highway Patrolman looks over hi shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paint, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paint ain't usually pulled  independently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm a truckin' whore. They got  the money, honey; I got the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Weight Station Worker laughs. The Highway Patrolman  doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna open her up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon fella, this paint's due in  Savannah yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word is some joker's running blocker  for an illegal load. We're just spot  checking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cledus notices the Weight Station Worker's name tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Ebersol... I've been through  this chicken coop a hundred times...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Weight Station Worker and the Georgia Highway  Patrolman have already started toward the rear of Bandit The Weight Station Worker jumps up to unlatch Bandit II's back doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cledus) We're just gonna take a quick peek- see. You'll be outta here in no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he can finish his sentence, the sound of SCREECHIN TIRES whips his head around.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT HE SEES
dialogues.text: Bandit I laying rubber all the way up the ramp, heading  straight toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Highway Patrolman and the Weight Station Worker dive cover, as Bandit I blasts past them, doing at least 90. Bandit whips the wheel to the right and the Shelby Cobra  roars around the Weight Station Shack on two wheels -- ti screaming. The Weight Station Worker and Georgia Highway Patrolman r back toward the Shack, completely forgetting Cledus.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT II
dialogues.text: Cledus casually eases the rig into first and rolls out of the parking area, onto the highway.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Nobody notices Cledus drive off, as Bandit I continues  screaming around the Weight Station -- tires smoking.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I
dialogues.text: Bandit sees Cledus has safely returned to the highway and whips around the Weight Station Shack for the final time hits the highway on ramp doing 100.

dialogues.speaker: THE WEIGHT STATION
dialogues.text: The Two Georgia Highway Patrolmen race toward their cars, leap and take off after Bandit I -- lights and sirens bla

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I roars past Bandit II, the Two Highway Patrol Car in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE LEAD HIGHWAY PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: The Georgia Highway Patrolman on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) ...in high speed pursuit of a black  Shelby Cobra. Mississippi license  Charles-Alan-Richard -- two-seven- three. Vehicle eastbound on Interstate  seventy-two. Request assistance.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Two Georgia Highway Patrol cars race past Bandit II.  Cledus gives them a small wave. They don't notice.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I
dialogues.text: as the Cobra comes racing up to the rear of a long line o slowmoving traffic. Bandit moves out to pass and sees:

dialogues.speaker: PICKUP TRUCK
dialogues.text: coming straight at him.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I
dialogues.text: swerves onto the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: THE PICKUP TRUCK
dialogues.text: does the same.

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT I AND THE PICKUP TRUCK
dialogues.text: Bandit I swerves back onto the highway. So does the Picku And it looks like a head-on for sure. At the last instant, Bandit swerves back onto the shoulde The Pickup rips past him and Bandit manages to pull the C back onto the highway and into the free lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Pickup Truck now is face-to-face with the First Ge Highway Patrol car. They jockey for position. The First  Highway Patrol car swerves and passes the Pickup, but the Second one hits the shoulder barely avoiding a head-on.

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND HIGHWAY PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: as it flies over the ditch and does a complete midair end over-end flip -- landing in a ditch. Out of the chase.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPRESSWAY OVERPASS
dialogues.text: Bandit I races toward the overpass, the Georgia Highway P car three hundred yards behind. Bandit I takes the hairpin turn full out and goes into a  four wheel drift. Bandit manages to maintain control and  punches it in mid-slide, blasting the Cobra through the t onto the Expressway below.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA HOLDS
dialogues.text: as the Highway Patrol car tries the same feat, loses cont and crashes into the chain link divider.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPRESSWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit roars onto the Expressway, sailing right past A GE STATE TROOPER'S CAR, parked on the shoulder, waiting for  speeders. The State Trooper fires up his engine and with red lights twirling and siren wailing, pulls out after Bandit I. Just as he does, the Georgia Highway Patrol car comes rac by and they slam into each other -- knocking both cars tw feet each way. Both cars straighten out and wait for the other to take t lead. The Trooper starts off. So does the Highway Patrol  car. The Trooper stops, so does the Highway Patrol car. T goes on for several beats until they both start off at th same time -- and smash right into each other again.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPRESSWAY
dialogues.text: as Bandit I races down the Expressway, the Two Police car finally get it together and take off after him.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit weaves in and out of traffic. Glances out his side mirror.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH SIDE MIRROR
dialogues.text: The Georgia Highway Patrol car and the Georgia State Troo racing down the Expressway, cars pulling onto the shoulde so they can pass.

dialogues.speaker: EXPRESSWAY ON RAMP
dialogues.text: A large red sign reads: WRONG WAY - DO NOT ENTER. Bandit blasts by the sign and enters the on ramp. Going the wron way!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT
dialogues.text: Bandit hugging the shoulder. Kate hugging the seat. Petri

dialogues.speaker: THEIR VIEW
dialogues.text: ANOTHER HIGHWAY PATROL CAR is coming down the ramp -- hea straight for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Highway Patrol car isn't giving ground, as Bandit I r toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear God in heaven!

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO CARS
dialogues.text: racing toward each other. Neither giving ground. A dead-o Chickie Run. Finally, at the last possible instant, the Highway Patrol car swerves to the right, crashing through the guard rail and sailing into:

dialogues.speaker: MIDAIR
dialogues.text: The Highway Patrol car flies through the air and crashes  down on the back of a moving FLATBED TRACTOR TRAILER. The Flatbed Truck just keeps driving. Not even noticing.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPRESSWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I, still going the wrong way. Up ahead -- an Expre full of cars -- headed straight for Bandit I. Bandit floorboards it, flies over the center divider and  ends up on the other side of the Expressway, just ahead o Bandit II.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: as they race down the Expressway, flying past another  billboard announcing: The Peach Tree Classic. Bandit wipes his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll we do for excitement on our  second date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before she can answer, from the CB:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Bandit I, let me offer my heartiest  congratulations and a piece of advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) What's that, pardner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Don't take that foot off the hammer,  'cause you got wall-to-wall Bears  about to pour over you like maple  syrup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit looks up in his rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, FIVE NEW GEORGIA HIGHWAY PATROL CARS, coming strong.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPRESSWAY
dialogues.text: as the Five Highway Patrol cars hit their sirens and wail past Bandit II, on their way after Bandit I. Bandit I quickly veers off the Expressway onto a crossing highway. The Police cars all follow. And Bandit II, continues whipping down the Expressway. At bound.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: as he flips the CB channel over to 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) I think it's time to call a mayday. (into mike) Breaker. Breaker. This is Bandit to  Hot Pants. Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over CB) Why should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Because I need your help, sweet thing. (glancing back, the  five Smokeys gaining  ground) And I need it bad.

dialogues.speaker: A DRIVE-IN RESTAURANT
dialogues.text: A teenage hangout. Really hopping. Country and Western MU blaring from the radios of Pickup Trucks, VW Vans, Sports Cars, etc, all parked in front of the restaurant. Almost  every vehicle sports a CB antenna. CAMERA FINDS a beautiful WAITRESS, holding a CB mike,  stretched out of a Customized MODEL A. Inside the Model A the Driver is eating a hamburger. The beautiful Waitress HOT PANTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I'm working, Bandit. Besides, what's  the matter? Won't your new girl friend  help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Hot Pants, please. I'm gonna be flying  by in about five minutes with Smokey  on my tail. Can you lock it off behind  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) What do you want me to do, Hot Pants?  Beg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I'm begging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I want you to know I'm doing this  against my better instincts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) But you'll do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I owe you a big one, Hot Pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike, sexily) You sure do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit hangs up the mike and turns to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (before she can say  anything) Yes, I actually dated a woman who  still wears hot pants.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPRESSWAY
dialogues.text: Bandit I whizzes past camera. Wait. Then here comes the  Highway Patrol. They've picked up reinforcements. Ten in  all.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Hot Pants has gathered all the cars from the drive-in and lined them up along both shoulders of the highway. Some a facing east. Some west. The drivers all wait in complete  silence. Finally, in the distance, the sound of sirens. Coming clo

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: as a speck rises over a hill and comes barrelling down th center divider, doing at least 120. A beat and a dozen mo specks top the hill and roar down the highway in pursuit. The specks quickly take form. Bandit I followed by a doze Georgia Highway Patrol cars. The vehicles parked along th shoulder all fire up their engines on cue. And wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit I roars past the cars parked along the shoulder. The instant Bandit I clears, the vehicles pull off the  shoulder and begin moving down the highway -- eastbound a westbound -- all doing a conservative law-abiding 55.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY PATROL CARS
dialogues.text: come roaring down the eastbound lane and find the road to blocked by teen-age traffic going both ways. They're stuc Even the shoulders are blocked by cars from the drive-in. Just in case. And as Bandit I disappears around a distant curve:

dialogues.speaker: EXPRESSWAY ON RAMP
dialogues.text: Camera follows Bandit I as it shoots down the highway and back onto the Expressway, just ahead of Bandit II.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I AND II
dialogues.text: Everyone breathes a sigh. Bandit clicks over the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) How's the clock, Bandit II.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Ticking away, but it looks like a  clear shot to Hot Town. Green lights  and white lines all the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate turns the rear view mirror towards her and straighte her hair. Bandit glances over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this could be the biggest house  I ever played to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit smiles as both he and Cledus trounce on their peda As Bandit I and II take off, Atlanta bound, we:

dialogues.speaker: TWO GEORGIA STATE POLICE CHOPPERS
dialogues.text: flving high over the highways leading into Atlanta. Over  this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paydirt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from the chopper. Bandit I and Bandit II blazing a trail  toward Atlanta.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHOPPERS
dialogues.text: as they swoop down toward camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We just picked up the Cobra  eastbound on Interstate 72 heading  for the Peach Tree Classic. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All units converge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now:

dialogues.speaker: A BIRD'S EYE VIEW
dialogues.text: of the Atlanta Expressway arteries. Every type of law  enforcement vehicle in the area -- STATE TROOPERS, LOCAL  POLICE, HIGHWAY PATROLMEN, the works -- are blowing down Expressway. Blue, Red and Yellow lights swirling.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA SWOOPS IN
dialogues.text: closer and picks up Bandit I and II. Driving like crazy.  Leading the pack. The Peach Tree Classic Track looms ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as TWENTY-SEVEN POLICE CARS converge behind Bandit I and forming an endless line of flashing lights. As the Two Bears in the sky fly in low over the Convoy, w go:

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT I
dialogues.text: The sounds of SIRENS and the WHOOSH of choppers is deafen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk about being popular...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he looks up ahead. And is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTRANCE TO THE FAIRGROUNDS
dialogues.text: Under a huge billboard announcing "The Peach Tree Classic is a greeting party. TEN COP CARS block the entrance gate the raceway. Twenty cops form a line in front of their  vehicles. TV cameras are poised.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: as Bandit fires up the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I hate to say it, man; but I think  it's over. Time to lay down our hand.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE BANDIT II
dialogues.text: Fred is now on all four in the front seat. Tail slapping  back and forth. Barking like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Are you loco, pardner!?! We've come  this far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Yeah, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) When we agree to do a job, we do it.  Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) But they're waiting for me. They  don't even know Cledus Snow exists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Well, they're gonna. It's time this  gearjammer rode to glory. (then) Now, move aside; good buddy. I'm  coming through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Cledus puts it to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the huge eighteen-wheeler takes the bullet lane and pa Bandit I, almost blowing off its doors.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONVOY
dialogues.text: led by Cledus in Bandit II. Roaring toward the race track gate. Hammer down. Stacks open. Horn blaring. Bandit I ri on his tail. And behind them, twenty-seven bubble gum machines lightin up the Georgia countryside.

dialogues.speaker: FAIRGROUNDS ENTRANCE GATE
dialogues.text: The COPS see Bandit II -- eighteen-wheels of terror -- ro down the hill and headed full steam toward them.

dialogues.speaker: THE COPS
dialogues.text: Some run to their cars as fast as they can, start 'em up scatter. Others just run as fast as they can, period. Utt chaos!

dialogues.speaker: BANDIT II
dialogues.text: as it comes barrelling toward the entrance gate, cutting  right through the remaining Police cars -- sending them  reeling. Then the big rig blasts through the entrance gate, demoli it and sending timber flying sky high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit II heads for the race track smoke stacks blasting. A beat and Bandit I, followed by half of Atlanta's Smokey comes roaring through what's left of the entrance gate.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STANDS
dialogues.text: The "Peach Tree Classic" is in progress. Stock Cars racin full speed around the track. But the CROWD'S attention is turned toward the entrance gate.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE BRAND AND HIS SON DICKEY
dialogues.text: sitting in a front row box. Kyle has binoculars up to his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: THRU BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: Bandit I and II roaring straight toward the stands.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO KYLE AND DICKEY
dialogues.text: Kyle lowers his binoculars and turns to his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That crazy sumbitch made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You just became a  legend maker.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRACK
dialogues.text: Stock cars whipping around the curves, as Bandit I and Ba II cut a path across the infield and roar onto the track screeching to a halt directly in front of Kyle's box.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THEM
dialogues.text: The Stock Cars swerve, slide and sail onto the infield -- trying to avoid collisions. The Convoy of Police Cars, their sirens blasting and thei advertising still swirling, are forced to stop -- as the  Stock Cars pile up in front of them. Flags go down. The r is abruptly halted. A helicopter still hovers low overhea

dialogues.speaker: THE STANDS
dialogues.text: The doors of Bandit I and II fly open and Bandit, Kate an Cledus all pile out and head for Kyle's box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes are on Bandit, Cledus, Kate, Kyle and Dickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to act casual) You got my barley pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (toothy smile) Have any trouble getting here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About one to five years worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Bandit,  stunned) One to five?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopefully) Maybe six months with good behavior. (resigned) One to five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coughs, then) Well, I guess I gotta hand it to  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his pocket and brings out a shiny new set keys. He then gestures toward the sidelines. They all tur

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: The late afternoon sun sparkles off the chrome smokestack of a brand-new KENWORTH EIGHTEEN-WHEELER.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kyle hands Bandit the keys. Behind them, the POLICE have all jumped out of their cars (which now, along with the stock cars, cover the entire  infield -- ) and are rushing toward Bandit and Cledus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (toothy grin) I wonder if they'll let you take a K- Whooper to prison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kyle) Mind if I cream your son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bandit) Don't sweat it. I'll have y'all out  on bail in no time. Fools like you  are valuable.

dialogues.speaker: TRACKING
dialogues.text: as Bandit, Kate and Cledus start across, toward the oncom rush of police. As they walk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Well, at least it hasn't been boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for the lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it was nothing) Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a long pause. The cops are now closing in. Cledus walks toward them -- arms outstretched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after an uneasy beat) What can I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me you won't fall in love  with an inmate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins. The cops are on top of them. Handcuffs on Bandi Kate moves forward, pushing the cops out of the way. And  kisses Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: THE STANDS
dialogues.text: as five thousand people cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a deafening ROAR is heard O.S. and all heads tu to see:

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF CLAYTON'S CAR
dialogues.text: storming through the gate and across the infield. The Tex Highway Patrol car is almost a complete wreck. So is the  driver. The car comes to a skidding halt and Sheriff Buell Clayto leaps out. He heads straight toward Bandit -- fists clenc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Get your hands off my daughter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton takes about five more frenzied steps, then sudden drops to the ground. And faints. Out cold. Everybody rushes forward, thinking the poor son-of-a-bitc is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bandit) He's just exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man is your father?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should've told you, but you would've  thrown me out, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speeding) Listen, he's nuts. I mean certifiable.  But believe it or not, he once looked  great in Levis. That's why my mother  married him. But like all good  things... (then) I know what you're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking over at  Clayton, still out  cold) You gotta admire the man's  determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him. A beat and the cops push Bandit and Cledus  into the back seat of the lead squad car. As Two Cops move around the front, Kate leans in the rear window.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE SQUAD CAR
dialogues.text: Bandit and Cledus. Handcuffed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the guys) Well, was it worth it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit and Cledus look at each other. Then nod. Then laug Kate laughs with them. Then the Two Cops hop in the front seat, as the other Twe Six Smokey's head for their cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cledus) I'll take care of Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now it's almost over. The Cop starts up the engine. K and Bandit look at each other for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya, Bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate backs away from the window, as the squad car pulls o followed by the endless line of Atlanta's finest. Their sirens now silent. But their advertising still flas And now, as we pull further and further away, watching th whole event become history... We hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Breaker, Breaker. This is Banana  Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yeah, Banana Peel, go head on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Did ya hear they nailed the Bandit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yeah, I heard. But they won't  hold him for long. Anyway, he sure  gave them sumbitches a run for their  money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And:
